measured_by: ρ (rho) parameter from the power-utility computational model applied to the risky-lottery choice task
justification: "We used a computational modeling framework to derive risk tolerance ... Risk tolerance is ρ. A risk neutral subject would have a ρ of 1..."

measured_by: β (beta) parameter from the power-utility computational model applied to the ambiguous-lottery choice task
justification: "Ambiguity tolerance is β... Positive values of β reflect ambiguity aversion, negative values reflect ambiguity seeking."

measured_by: Percentage of risky options chosen in the lottery task
justification: "Participants selected the risky option, on average, on 42.49% of trials in the solo condition ... we tested whether participants changed the proportion of risky choices they selected."
